Lately, I have been missing some comments on bugs (i.e. someone makes a comment on a bug I'm interested in and I don't notice it right away).  When a Bugzilla task editor is open and the bug has incoming changes, it says "Task has incoming changes, synchronize to view" at the top of the editor but I don't always notice this message.   

The part I've found most confusing was that I always synchronize my queries when I start using Eclipse and then open the bugs with the "incoming" arrows - but, if the editor was already open it doesn't actually refresh with the new comments, it just stays as it was.  It still says "Task has incoming changes, synchronize to view" at the top, but I guess I didn't notice that, so I couldn't figure out what had changed on the bug and assumed that it was something small that I didn't notice.  It works fine if I close the editor and re-open it, I just didn't realize that I had to do that.
*** Bug 182015 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

David's post from bug#182015: Since updating to 2.0M2, I have noticed that when I get notified of a bugzilla task update, and I already have an editor open on that task, the editor is not being refreshed with the latest data, even when I click the sync icon multiple times or double click on the task in the task view multiple times.  I have to close and reopen the editor for it to display the new task data (such as new attachments or comments).
Fixed. Due to editor equality, task was being marked read but editor remain in original state. Editor now refreshes in place if already open and selected form task list.

It looks like this caused the following regression?  You should be able to reproduce by opening a task that's already open.  I was using Open Corresponding Task from an incoming change set via the Synchronize view.
